column1: Kata Robata////Aside from the traditional Japanese dishes
column2: Kata's other entree dishes and signature rolls are either innovative combinations of unlikely ingredients like the signature lobster mac and cheese or luxurious congregations of traditional Japanese ingredients. One example of a luxurious congregation is the Longhorn Roll ($15)
column3: a fusion sushi roll that boasts a proud roster of shrimp tempura and grilled eel with each piece topped with a large avocado piece and drizzled with unagi sauce and three kinds of flying fish roes. Kata Robata aims to deliver a surprising symphony of tastes with a unique ensemble or a large orchestra of ingredients.
